answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some other examples of mayors who made performance measurement a priority.
The Mayor of Madison Wisconsin, David J. Cieslewicz has helped implement a program called Madison Measures which uses citizen input to help gauge performance measurement. 
The Madison Measures PDF is below:
http://www.cityofmadison.com/finance/documents/madisonmeasures-2011.pdf
I have also included a youtube video of the mayor describing the program and how it works.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=27DbzR0KTlE
In New Orleans, Mayor Mitch Landrieue recently released that he is working on two projects to improve performance measurement. One is called BottomLineStat which will hold departments accountable for their budgets. The other is called ReqtoCheckStat and it will help streamline the city’s contracting system. 
http://www.nola.com/politics/index.ssf/2011/09/mayor_mitch_landrieu_announces.html 
I hope these help!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Efrem Bycer
text:
I'm wokring on a small project right now that involves identifying examples of when big city mayors have put improving governance and the use of perfromance measurement tools at the forefront of their agendas.  I am familiar with Mayor Bloombergs Simplicity initiative in NYC and Mayor (now Governor) O'Malley's CitiStat in Baltimore.  Please let me know of other examples that come to mind and if possible point me to articles, reports, and other publications with information.  
Please feel free to contact me at ebycer@sandiego.gov.  Thank you.
title: Examples of Big City Mayors Improving Governance and Using Perofrmance Metrics
